title: I.Sicily inscription 003401
support: Fragment of a marble plaque, intact on the left but broken on the other three sides.

handNote.lettering: (Following Orsi's apograph in his taccuino) Small regular neat letters with terminations to the strokes but no signficant serifs. Alpha has straight bar; Epislon has slightly shortened middle bar; Zeta is vertical with wide top and bottom horizontal strokes; Kappa has slightly shortened arms; Mu has vertical first and last, with the middle strokes almost reaching to the base line; omicron is full-size; Sigma has parallel top and bottom strokes; Omega is round full-sized, and almost closed.

provenanceFound._: Recovered during the demolition of the 16th century fortifications at the entrance to Ortygia in July 1889

provenanceObserved._: Not yet identified (Manganaro could not find it prior to 1999)

facsimile.desc: I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana

museum.name: Museo Archeologico Regionale Paolo Orsi
museum.description: An outstanding collection of archaeological material. The collection ranges from Siracusa and the surrounding territory (Megara Hyblaia, Akrai, Kasmenai etc) to encompass all of eastern Sicily, reaching as far as Gela and Agrigento. The ground floor covers prehistory through to the end of the Classical period. Upstairs includes Hellenistic and Roman Syracuse and a display of material from the catacombs. A gallery displaying material from Hellenistic eastern Sicily is in preparation.
